title: 7-Day New Dawn in Machu Picchu: Lima, Cusco & Sacred Valley
description: Driving from Lima to Machu Picchu can take more than 15 hours if it‚Äôs done in one long stretch; however, this comprehensive 7-day, small-group tour of Peru lets you visit both, as well as many popular attractions and cities in between without worrying about transport. Begin in Lima, discovering gems like Plaza de Armas and the Larco Museum. Then, head to Cusco, Archaeological Park of Sacsayhuaman, the Sacred Valley, and Machu Picchu. Accommodation and most meals are included.

Maria Z
29 contributions

Best way to see Peru in 7 days!

Sep 2025 ‚Ä¢ Friends
We were able to see so much of Peru - from Lima to Cusco, Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu! The tour company was great with communication and the itinerary before the trip started. We arrived in Lima a day early to explore it a bit more. They picked us up, helped us with the hotel check in and even stayed with us throughout the check in process at the airport when we left for Cusco. We elected to go with the Deluxe package and I must say these hotels are top notch and worth the upgrade!

All the tour guides were fantastic! Catherine was wonderful in Lima, Robinson was great in Cusco, Fidel was amazing throughout Sacred Valley and helped us with the craziness of the train strike to Machu Picchu. It was a wild week to visit there where many tourists had to alter their plans. We were incredibly grateful for the care and professionalism throughout the fiasco. We wouldn't have known how to navigate the bus/train situation otherwise. And the best news - we made it!!! Our last day was Machu Picchu and it was beautiful. Thank you Vipac for your expertise!!
Written September 20, 2025
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Gilse P
1 contribution

Great experience

Sep 2025 ‚Ä¢ Friends
On the day of the tour to Machu Pichu there was a shutdown of the buses, which caused turmoil, delay in the tour, emotional wear, anxiety and waiting for 3 hours for the situation to be defined - a couple of our group followed one of the guides that went on foot to Machu Pichu, a real absurd!

The guides were extremely attentive, full knowledge of the places visited, polite and friendly.

The drivers were polite, helpful and drove cautiously.
Automatically translated
Written September 9, 2025
